anxiety.question: When you think of the word stress, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Your main source of stress comes from a sense of responsibility.
answers.suggestion: Set clear boundaries between your obligations and your rest time.

answers.description: Your anxiety often comes from social situations.
answers.suggestion: Work on gradually exposing yourself to social interactions.

answers.description: You are afraid of making mistakes and being judged.
answers.suggestion: Focus on progress instead of perfection.

answers.description: You are aware of your inner restlessness.
answers.suggestion: Practice breathing techniques to help calm your mind.

depression.question: What is the first word that comes to your mind when you hear happiness?

answers.description: You feel disconnected from positive emotions.
answers.suggestion: Try to notice and appreciate small moments of joy each day.

answers.description: You feel that happiness is not real or lasting.
answers.suggestion: Practice gratitude and acknowledge small successes.

answers.description: You find comfort and support from close relationships.
answers.suggestion: Nurture relationships that give you a sense of belonging.

answers.description: You associate happiness with inner calm.
answers.suggestion: Work on balancing obligations with personal rest and relaxation.

depression.question: When you think about yourself, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: You feel emotionally and physically drained.
answers.suggestion: Give yourself time for rest and recovery.

answers.description: Low self-esteem influences your self-image.
answers.suggestion: Recall times when you contributed positively to others.

answers.description: You are looking for a way to improve your current state.
answers.suggestion: Set small and achievable goals to move forward.

answers.description: You have a desire for a better future.
answers.suggestion: Nurture this feeling through small positive actions each day.

depression.question: When you hear the word morning, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Waking up feels like a challenge.
answers.suggestion: Create a gentle morning routine that motivates you.

answers.description: You see morning as an opportunity for a fresh start.
answers.suggestion: Plan small achievable goals to maintain this positive perspective.

answers.description: You often feel low on energy at the start of the day.
answers.suggestion: Include light physical activity in your morning routine.

answers.description: You enjoy quiet and slow starts to the day.
answers.suggestion: Use the morning for reflection or meditation.

depression.question: When you think of the past, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: You focus on past mistakes.
answers.suggestion: Remember that you did your best in those situations.

answers.description: Thinking about the past brings nostalgia and sometimes sadness.
answers.suggestion: Try to also recall positive moments from the past.

answers.description: You focus on things that went wrong.
answers.suggestion: Turn past experiences into lessons rather than burdens.

answers.description: You have made peace with what has already happened.
answers.suggestion: Maintain that sense of acceptance.

depression.question: When you think about your daily life, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Daily responsibilities feel too much at times.
answers.suggestion: Break tasks into small steps and prioritize them.

answers.description: Life feels repetitive and unexciting.
answers.suggestion: Add small variations to your daily activities.

answers.description: You feel constant pressure from responsibilities.
answers.suggestion: Use relaxation techniques and self-care breaks regularly.

answers.description: You look for reasons to keep going despite challenges.
answers.suggestion: Focus on small, achievable goals to build momentum.

adhd.question: When you hear the word focus, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: It is difficult for you to maintain concentration for long periods.
answers.suggestion: Use short work intervals followed by brief breaks.

answers.description: Your thoughts often wander in many directions.
answers.suggestion: Write down your ideas immediately to reduce mental clutter.

answers.description: You can focus only when the topic captures your full attention.
answers.suggestion: Connect tasks with personal interests to increase engagement.

answers.description: You feel overwhelmed by the many thoughts running through your mind.
answers.suggestion: Organize your workspace and use reminders to stay on track.

adhd.question: When you think of school or work, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Routine tasks are difficult for you to focus on.
answers.suggestion: Add variety to your daily schedule to maintain attention.

answers.description: You feel pressure from deadlines and responsibilities.
answers.suggestion: Break large tasks into smaller, manageable steps.

answers.description: You are motivated when challenges capture your interest.
answers.suggestion: Seek opportunities that allow you to be creative.

answers.description: Lack of structure makes it difficult for you to manage tasks.
answers.suggestion: Create a simple daily plan or to-do list to follow.

adhd.question: When you hear the word peace, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: Periods of silence can make you feel uneasy.
answers.suggestion: Use short moments of calm to reset your mind.

answers.description: You look for a space free of distractions.
answers.suggestion: Create a quiet corner where you can recharge your energy.

answers.description: Stillness feels uncomfortable because you are constantly in motion.
answers.suggestion: Practice mindfulness while moving, such as during walks.

answers.description: You are able to recognize when your body and mind need a break.
answers.suggestion: Include short rest periods throughout the day.

adhd.question: When you think of planning, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: You find it difficult to keep track of all your tasks and obligations.
answers.suggestion: Use planning tools and apps with reminders to stay organized.

answers.description: You feel that plans rarely work for you.
answers.suggestion: Focus on flexible goals instead of rigid schedules.

answers.description: Planning helps you to take action and move forward.
answers.suggestion: Maintain this energy by setting small and achievable goals.

answers.description: You get lost in too many ideas at once.
answers.suggestion: Prioritize three main tasks per day to stay on track.

adhd.question: When you think about tasks, what is the first word that comes to your mind?

answers.description: You often feel there are too many tasks to manage.
answers.suggestion: Break tasks into smaller steps and tackle them one by one.

answers.description: You delay starting tasks that feel difficult or boring.
answers.suggestion: Set small starting points to overcome avoidance.

answers.description: Your ability to complete tasks depends on your interest level.
answers.suggestion: Match tasks with moments when you have more energy or focus.

answers.description: You are easily distracted by surrounding stimuli.
answers.suggestion: Reduce distractions and create a focused workspace.

well-being.question: I have felt cheerful and in good spirits.

answers.description: You have not felt cheerful and in good spirits.
answers.suggestion: Try to find activities that make you feel good.

answers.description: You have felt cheerful and in good spirits some of the time.
answers.suggestion: Try to find activities that make you feel good.

answers.description: You have felt cheerful and in good spirits less than half the time.
answers.suggestion: Try to make time for activities that make you feel good.

answers.suggestion: Try to find activities that make you feel good.

answers.description: You have felt cheerful and in good spirits most of the time.
answers.suggestion: Keep up activities that make you feel good.

answers.description: You have felt cheerful and in good spirits all of the time.
answers.suggestion: Good work, keep up activities that make you feel good.
